ratings.comment: Nice guy and clearly knows the material. If you listen carefully he makes really funny comments under his breath. Definitely teaches the way that the textbook does, more formula based. Grading for 301 is almost completely based on attendance and homework completion. The homework is nice extra practice for 303 and Exam FM.

I was often times confused during class, but it might just be because of difficulty of the C/4 material.  Still, he could be more clear. But whenever you are really stuck, Greg is more than willing to help--he definitely cares about his students.    I recommend buying an Exam C/4 manual to practice as you go through the topics in class.

Greg shows different sides to the information you learn in 303 which helps solidify key concepts. He's very smart and sometimes difficult to see how he gets some conclusions, but if you ask for clarification he will help you until you get it.

Greg is too smart to teach. He knows everything that you ever need to know about FM but cannot translate it to dumb people words. Notice how he says "okay" or "going in" a million times in class and you will never be able to focus ever again.

Prof Wanner takes a lot of time to explain almost every detail of the lecture notes, which can be helpful but boring too. The lecture notes are very convenient but essentially come straight from the book. Weekly quizzes aren't too bad. Exams are hard and aren't curved as much as I was expecting. He also takes a long time to respond to emails.
